database.description: The database name to be used when using an external database driver. Will be ignored when you activate one of the integrated databases with mariadb.enabled, mysql.enabled or postgresql.enabled
database.title: database

existingSecret.description: Use existing secret for password details (`config.database.auth.password` will be ignored and picked up from this secret). The secret has to contain the key `database-password`.
existingSecret.title: existingSecret

password.description: The password credential to be used when using an external database driver.
password.title: password

username.description: The username credential to be used when using an external database driver.
username.title: username

driver.description: mysql, maria, postgres or sqlite. Will be set automatically when you activate one of the integrated databases with mariadb.enabled, mysql.enabled or postgresql.enabled
driver.title: driver

host.description: The host name of the database server when using an external database driver. Will be ignored when you activate one of the integrated databases with mariadb.enabled, mysql.enabled or postgresql.enabled
host.title: host

port.description: The port in which the database service is running when using an external database driver. Default value is based on the value provided for DB_DRIVER. Will be ignored when you activate one of the integrated databases with mariadb.enabled, mysql.enabled or postgresql.enabled
port.title: port

useEncryption.description: Whether it is desired to use an encrypted connection with the database or not
useEncryption.title: useEncryption

basePath.description: The base path from which you plan to serve Shlink, in case you don’t want to serve it from the root of the domain. It has to start with a bar, like /shlink. Defaults to ''.
basePath.title: basePath

cacheNamespace.description: A prefix used for all cache keys generated by Shlink. It’s important to set a unique value here if you have multiple Shlink instances sharing the same cache store (same server when not using redis, or same redis cluster), otherwise there could be collisions. Defaults to Shlink.
cacheNamespace.title: cacheNamespace

defaultDomain.description: The default short domain used for this Shlink instance. For example s.test.
defaultDomain.title: defaultDomain

initialApiKey.description: An API key that will be created once during container start-up, with admin permissions.
initialApiKey.title: initialApiKey

isHttpsEnabled.description: Tells if Shlink is served with https or not (true or false). It’s still up to you to actually serve it with HTTPS.
isHttpsEnabled.title: isHttpsEnabled

memoryLimit.description: The maximum amount of memory that every Shlink process can use. You can provide a number, which will be the amount of memory in bytes, or a number followed by K for kilobytes, M for megabytes or G for gigabytes. You can also provide -1 to set no memory limit. Defaults to 512M.
memoryLimit.title: memoryLimit

timezone.description: A timezone code as defined [in this list](https://www.php.net/manual/en/timezones.php). All dates stored by Shlink (visits, short URL creation, etc) will be considered to be on this timezone. By default, the default timezone set in PHP config will be used, which is UTC in the case of the docker image.
timezone.title: timezone

licenseKey.description: The license key used to download new GeoLite2 database files. Go to GeoLite2 license key to know how to generate it. Not providing a license key will completely disable visits geolocation.
licenseKey.title: licenseKey

skipInitialDownload.description: If provided with value true, it will skip the initial GeoLite2 db file download, speeding-up the container start-up. As a side effect, first visits on this container will remain un-located until the file finishes downloading in background.
skipInitialDownload.title: skipInitialDownload

apiToken.description: The API token so that Shlink can call Matomo’s API
apiToken.title: apiToken

existingSecret.description: Use existing secret for the API token details (`config.matomo.auth.apiToken` will be ignored and picked up from this secret). The secret has to contain the key `api-token`.
existingSecret.title: existingSecret

enabled.description: Enable the Matomo integration to sent visits
enabled.title: enabled

siteId.description: The site ID to be used for Shlink visits.
siteId.title: siteId

existingSecret.description: Use existing secret for the JWT secret details (`config.mercure.auth.jwtSecret` will be ignored and picked up from this secret). The secret has to contain the key `jwt-secret`.
existingSecret.title: existingSecret

jwtSecret.description: The secret key that was provided to the mercure hub server, in order to be able to generate valid JWTs for publishing/subscribing to that server.
jwtSecret.title: jwtSecret

internalHubUrl.description: An internal URL for a mercure hub. Will be used only when publishing updates to mercure, and does not need to be public.
internalHubUrl.title: internalHubUrl

publicHubUrl.description: The public URL of a mercure hub server to which Shlink will sent updates. This URL will also be served to consumers that want to subscribe to those updates.
publicHubUrl.title: publicHubUrl

codeForDisabledShortUrls.description: Whether generating QR codes should work for disabled short URLs. Disabled short URLs are those which reached the maximum amount of visits, have a validSince date in the future, or a validUntil date in the past.
codeForDisabledShortUrls.title: codeForDisabledShortUrls

defaultErrorCorrection.description: One of L (Low), M (Medium), Q (Quartile) or H (High), to determine the default error correction of generated QR codes when the errorCorrection query param is not provided.
defaultErrorCorrection.title: defaultErrorCorrection

defaultFormat.description: One of png or svg, to determine the default format of generated QR codes when the format query param is not provided.
defaultFormat.title: defaultFormat

defaultLogoUrl.description: A URL pointing to a logo that will be placed in the middle of the QR code. This one is experimental, as some images might break the QR code.
defaultLogoUrl.title: defaultLogoUrl

defaultMargin.description: A value greater than 0 to determine the default margin of generated QR codes when the margin query param is not provided.
defaultMargin.title: defaultMargin

defaultRoundBlockSize.description: Tells if the block size should be round on QR codes, making it more readable, but potentially adding some extra margin as a side effect.
defaultRoundBlockSize.title: defaultRoundBlockSize

defaultSize.description: A value between 50 and 1000 to determine the default size of generated QR codes when the size query param is not provided.
defaultSize.title: defaultSize

existingSecret.description: Use existing secret for password details (`config.rabbitmq.auth.password` will be ignored and picked up from this secret). The secret has to contain the key `rabbitmq-password`.
existingSecret.title: existingSecret

password.description: The password credential to be used when using an external database driver.
password.title: password

username.description: The username credential to be used when using an external database driver.
username.title: username

useSsl.description: Whether connection is encrypted with SSL/TLS or not.
useSsl.title: useSsl

cacheLifetime.description: Allows to set the amount of seconds that redirects should be cached when redirect status is 301 or 308.
cacheLifetime.title: cacheLifetime

defaultBaseUrlRedirect.description: If a URL is provided here, when a user tries to access Shlink’s base URL, and the visited domain does not have a redirect URL of its own, he/she will be redirected to this value. If this env var is not provided, the user will see a generic 404 - not found page.
defaultBaseUrlRedirect.title: defaultBaseUrlRedirect

defaultInvalidShortUrlRedirect.description: If a URL is provided here, when a user tries to access an invalid short URL, and the visited domain does not have a redirect URL of its own, he/she will be redirected to this value. If this env var is not provided, the user will see a generic 404 - not found page.
defaultInvalidShortUrlRedirect.title: defaultInvalidShortUrlRedirect

defaultRegular404Redirect.description: If a URL is provided here, when a user tries to access a URL not matching any supported by the router, and the visited domain does not have a redirect URL of its own, he/she will be redirected to this value. If this env var is not provided, the user will see a generic 404 - not found page.
defaultRegular404Redirect.title: defaultRegular404Redirect

extraPathMode.description: Determines how Shlink should match short URLs when they start with a known short code. Valid values are default, append and ignore. (See [Extra path forwarding](https://shlink.io/documentation/some-features/#extra-path-forwarding) for more info).
extraPathMode.title: extraPathMode

statusCode.description: 301, 302, 308 or 307 (last two since v3.5.0). Determines the status code that should be used on redirects from short to long URLs. Setting 308 or 307 implicitly makes requests to short URLs work regardless the HTTP method.
statusCode.title: statusCode

pubSubEnabled.description: Tells if the configured redis instance/cluster should also be used to publish real-time updates via redis pub/sub.
pubSubEnabled.title: pubSubEnabled

service.description: The name of the sentinel service if you want to use redis sentinel. If this value is provided, the servers provided in config.redis.servers will be considered sentinel instances.
service.title: service

servers.description: The comma-separated list of Redis servers when using external Redis servers. Will be ignored when you activate one of the integrated Redis subchart with redis.enabled
servers.title: servers

allowAllShortUrls.description: Whether all short URLs should be allowed via robots.txt or not. If set to true, the crawlable option set in individual short URLs will be ignored.
allowAllShortUrls.title: allowAllShortUrls

userAgents.description: A comma-separated list of allowed user agents via robots.txt.
userAgents.title: userAgents

anonymizeRemoteAddr.description: Tells if IP addresses from visitors should be obfuscated before storing them in the database. See [Tracking visits](https://shlink.io/documentation/tracking-visits/) for more info.
anonymizeRemoteAddr.title: anonymizeRemoteAddr

disable.description: Tells if visits tracking should be completely disabled. See [Tracking visits](https://shlink.io/documentation/tracking-visits/) for more info.
disable.title: disable

disableIpTracking.description: Tells if tracking of the IP address (and therefore visitors location) should be disabled. See [Tracking visits](https://shlink.io/documentation/tracking-visits/) for more info.
disableIpTracking.title: disableIpTracking

disableReferrerTracking.description: Tells if tracking of the referrer should be disabled. See [Tracking visits](https://shlink.io/documentation/tracking-visits/) for more info.
disableReferrerTracking.title: disableReferrerTracking

disableTrackingFrom.description: A comma-separated list of IP address patterns from which all tracking should be disabled. It allows providing fixed IP addresses (100.200.80.40), CIDR blocks (192.168.10.0/24) or wildcard patterns (11.22.*.*)
disableTrackingFrom.title: disableTrackingFrom

disableTrackingParam.description: The name of a query param that can be used to visit short URLs avoiding the visit to be tracked. This feature won’t be available if no value is provided. See [Tracking visits](https://shlink.io/documentation/tracking-visits/) for more info.
disableTrackingParam.title: disableTrackingParam

disableUaTracking.description: Tells if tracking of the user agent should be disabled. See [Tracking visits](https://shlink.io/documentation/tracking-visits/) for more info.
disableUaTracking.title: disableUaTracking

trackOrphanVisits.description: Tells if orphan visits should be tracked or not. See [Tracking visits](https://shlink.io/documentation/tracking-visits/) for more info.
trackOrphanVisits.title: trackOrphanVisits

autoResolveTitles.description: Used to automatically resolve the short URL’s title based on the title-tag in the long URL
autoResolveTitles.title: autoResolveTitles

defaultShortCodesLength.description: The length you want generated short codes to have. It defaults to 5 and has to be at least 4, so any value smaller than that will fall back to 4.
defaultShortCodesLength.title: defaultShortCodesLength

deleteShortUrlThreshold.description: The amount of visits on short URLs which will not allow them to be deleted. If not provided, this restriction will be disabled.
deleteShortUrlThreshold.title: deleteShortUrlThreshold

multiSegmentSlugsEnabled.description: Allows to create and handle multi-segment custom slugs when true is provided. See [multi-segment custom slugs](https://shlink.io/documentation/some-features/#multi-segment-custom-slugs) for more information.
multiSegmentSlugsEnabled.title: multiSegmentSlugsEnabled

shortUrlMode.description: Determines how to match short URLs. Valid values are strict or loose. See [short URLs mode](https://shlink.io/documentation/some-features/#short-urls-mode) for more information.
shortUrlMode.title: shortUrlMode

shortUrlTrailingSlash.description: Allows to enable support for trailing slashes in short URLs when true is provided. See [short URLs trailing slash](https://shlink.io/documentation/some-features/#short-urls-trailing-slash) for more information.
shortUrlTrailingSlash.title: shortUrlTrailingSlash

extraEnv.description: additional environment variables to be added to the pods. See https://shlink.io/documentation/environment-variables for a complete list.
extraEnv.title: extraEnv

imagePullSecrets.description: If defined, uses a Secret to pull an image from a private Docker registry or repository.
imagePullSecrets.title: imagePullSecrets

database.description: The database name to be used when using the integrated MariaDB database.
database.title: database

password.description: The password credential to be used when using the integrated MariaDB database.
password.title: password

username.description: The username credential to be used when using the integrated MariaDB database.
username.title: username

enabled.description: enable integrated MariaDB™ subchart from Bitnami
enabled.title: enabled

repository.description: image repository for MariaDB™ subchart from Bitnami
repository.title: repository

tag.description: image tag for MariaDB™ subchart from Bitnami
tag.title: tag

database.description: The database name to be used when using the integrated MySQL database.
database.title: database

password.description: The password credential to be used when using the integrated MySQL database.
password.title: password

username.description: The username credential to be used when using the integrated MySQL database.
username.title: username

enabled.description: enable integrated MySQL™ subchart from Bitnami
enabled.title: enabled

repository.description: image repository for MySQL™ subchart from Bitnami
repository.title: repository

tag.description: image tag for MySQL™ subchart from Bitnami
tag.title: tag

nameOverride.description: Provide a name in place of `shlink-backend`
nameOverride.title: nameOverride

podAnnotations.description: Annotations to be added to pods
podAnnotations.title: podAnnotations

podLabels.description: Labels to be added to pods
podLabels.title: podLabels

database.description: The database name to be used when using the integrated PostgreSQL database.
database.title: database

password.description: The password credential to be used when using the integrated PostgreSQL database.
password.title: password

username.description: The username credential to be used when using the integrated PostgreSQL database.
username.title: username

enabled.description: enable integrated PostgreSQL™ subchart from Bitnami
enabled.title: enabled

repository.description: image repository for PostgreSQL™ subchart from Bitnami
repository.title: repository

tag.description: image tag for PostgreSQL™ subchart from Bitnami
tag.title: tag

enabled.description: enable integrated RabbitMQ™ subchart from Bitnami
enabled.title: enabled

repository.description: image repository for RabbitMQ™ subchart from Bitnami
repository.title: repository

tag.description: image tag for RabbitMQ™ subchart from Bitnami
tag.title: tag

sentinel.description: Enable password authentication on Redis™ Sentinels
sentinel.title: sentinel

enabled.description: enable integrated Redis™ subchart from Bitnami
enabled.title: enabled

repository.description: image repository for Redis™ subchart from Bitnami
repository.title: repository

tag.description: image tag for Redis™ subchart from Bitnami
tag.title: tag

enabled.description: Use Redis™ Sentinel on Redis™ pods
enabled.title: enabled

resources.description: Resource limits and requests for the headwind pods.
resources.title: resources

revisionHistoryLimit.description: The number of old ReplicaSets to retain
revisionHistoryLimit.title: revisionHistoryLimit

port.description: Kubernetes port where service is exposed
port.title: port

annotations.description: Annotations to add to the service account
annotations.title: annotations

create.description: Specifies whether a service account should be created
create.title: create

name.description:
The name of the service account to use.
If not set and create is true, a name is generated using the fullname template
name.title: name
